edu.bath.transitivityutils
Class OrderList<E>

java.lang.Object
  edu.bath.transitivityutils.OrderList<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<E>
public final class OrderList<E>
extends Object
implements Iterable<E>, Serializable

A doubly-linked circular list, where pairs of elements can be tested for precedence in constant time.

This structure consists of a list of OrderList.Nodes, each one representing a user element, plus a base sentinel node, which is always the first node of the list, and which does not correspond to a user element (trying to access or set its element results in a NoSuchElementException). list.base().previous() represents the last node of the list, while for any node n, n == n.next().previous() == n.previous().next() always holds.

Behavior of an OrderList instance becomes undefined if methods that accept a OrderList.Node argument are invoked on it with a node argument not created by it, or similarly if a node belonging to it is applied to a method of a different OrderList instance. For memory usage considerations, Node instances do not remember the OrderList instance that owns them, so application code must be careful not to use an OrderList with nodes that does not belong to it.

See Also:
Two Simplified Algorithms for Maintaining Order in a List (Bender et al., 2002), Serialized Form

Method Detail

create

public static <E> OrderList<E> create()
Creates a new, empty OrderList.

base

public OrderList.Node<E> base()
Returns the base (sentinel) node, which precedes any other node in this list. The base can be used to add nodes at the start of this list, i.e. by list.addAfter(list.base(), newElement).

The base node has no associated element and cannot be deleted.

delete

public boolean delete(OrderList.Node<E> node)
Deletes a node from this OrderList, if the node is not already deleted. The base node can never be deleted.

Important: if the supplied node is not owned by this OrderList (i.e., it is neither created by an invocation to addAfter(OrderList.Node, Object) on this instance nor it is its base()}) then both this instance and the OrderList instance that owns that node become undefined.

Parameters:
node - the node to delete from this OrderList
Returns:
true if the node was successfully deleted, false if the node is already deleted, or the node is the base node.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of nodes (not counting the base node) contained in this instance.

addAfter

public OrderList.Node<E> addAfter(OrderList.Node<E> node,
                                  E value)
Adds a new node, with the given value, immediately after the specified node. The node must belong to this OrderList instance, and it must have not been deleted.

To prepend a node to this OrderList, call addAfter(base(), value).

Parameters:
node - the node after which to add another node
value - the value of the new node
Returns:
the new node
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the specified node has been deleted
